abstracts.cdata!:
The higher-level objective of the Ceara
            Second Sector Wide Approach (SWAP) Inclusine Growth Project
            of Brazil is to contribute to expand and consolidate the
            social advances and institutional modernization of the State
            of Ceara. The project will achieve this by supporting nine
            key government investment programs in five sectors, selected
            to optimize development impact. A series of
            disbursement-linked indicators (14) are mapped to the five
            sectors -- public sector management, education, health,
            Water Resource Management/Water Supply and Sanitation
            (WRM/WSS), and business environment and innovation -- to
            strengthen the incentives to achieve results. Specifically,
            the project development objectives are to: 1) help the
            Government of Ceara to improve its fiscal situation; 2)
            strengthen the state's system of results-based
            management; 3) promote better service quality in education
            (particularly childhood literacy and health; 4) improve
            access to WSS, increase cost recovery in the water sector,
            and improve the efficiency of the two government autarchies
            with responsibility for water supply and management; and 5)
            reduce barriers to business investment. The potential
            safeguard impacts associated with this project are linked to
            hospital certification (hospital waste disposal) and
            investments in WSS connections. No potential large scale,
            significant and/or irreversible impacts are anticipated
            owing to the activities of the project. The works related to
            water and sanitation will be localized and site-specific.
            Some specific investments for WSS may result in
            site-specific, reversible impacts that will be mitigated.
            Involuntary resettlements, if any, associated with these
            programs will be localized.
